name: clinical care use
definition: This data use modifier indicates that use is allowed for clinical use and care.

name: collaboration required
definition: This requirement indicates that the requestor must agree to collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).

name: ethics approval required
definition: This requirement indicates that the requestor must provide documentation of local IRB/ERB approval.

name: genetic studies only
definition: This data use limitation indicates that use is limited to genetic studies only (i.e., no phenotype-only research)

name: geographical restriction
definition: This should be coupled with an ontology term describing the geographical location the restriction applies to.

name: institution specific restriction
definition: This requirement indicates that use is limited to use within an approved institution.

name: no general methods research
definition: This data use limitation indicates that use includes methods development research(e.g., development of software or algorithms) only within the bounds of other use limitations.

name: not for profit, non commercial use only
definition: This requirement indicates that use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations and not-for-profit use, non-commercial use.

name: non-commercial use only
definition: This indicates that data can be used by commercial organisations for research purposes, but not commercial purposes.

name: not for profit organisation use only
definition: This data use modifier indicates that use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

name: population origins or ancestry research prohibited
definition: This data use modifier indicates use for purposes of population, origin, or ancestry research is prohibited.

name: project specific restriction
definition: This data use modifier indicates that use is limited to use within an approved project.

name: publication moratorium
definition: This requirement indicates that requestor agrees not to publish results of studies until a specific date.

name: publication required
definition: This requirement indicates that requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.

name: research specific restrictions
definition: This data use limitation indicates that use is limited to studies of a certain research type.

name: return to database or resource
definition: This requirement indicates that the requestor must return derived/enriched data to the database/resource.

name: time limit on use
definition: This requirement indicates that use is approved for a specific number of months.

name: user specific restriction
definition: This requirement indicates that use is limited to use by approved users.

name: research with incidental findings permitted with obligation to report
definition: Research with a chance of incidental findings is permitted with an obligation to report incidental findings.

name: research with incidental findings permitted without obligation to report
definition: Research with a chance of incidental findings is permitted without an obligation to report incidental findings.

name: research with incidental findings prohibited
definition: Research with a chance of incidental findings is prohibited.

name: equivalent legal data protection required
definition: Equivalent legal data protection is required. This term should be combined with a list of relevant data protection laws requirements.

name: research with individual-level linkage prohibited
definition: This requirement indicates that use of the data is limited to studies in which different data types about the same individual from different datasets are not combined. Linking data is usually used to compile epidemiological data, leading to a richer dataset. The logic of record linkage is that two or more items of information about a person recorded at different times, and perhaps in different places, may be of greater value when considered together than when either is considered alone. The potential risk is that the data subjects in the dataset become more identifiable.
